intro: Microschizaea australis, commonly known as the Australian microschizaea, is a rare and specialized aquatic plant native to the southern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Schizaeaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate fronds that are typically less than 10 centimeters in length. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in swampy areas or along the margins of ponds. Its unique morphology includes a rhizome system that anchors it to the substrate and supports its growth in wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Microschizaea australis is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
